body_html: That variable is not used by TF, but by dlopen which is a system call. PS: only older macs support CUDA, which means that GPUs are old/slow and don't give a performance advantage over CPU. The main reason for using GPU tensorflow on Mac is for debugging a model that you'll eventually deploy on linux GPU
body_text: That variable is not used by TF, but by dlopen which is a system call. PS: only older macs support CUDA, which means that GPUs are old/slow and don't give a performance advantage over CPU. The main reason for using GPU tensorflow on Mac is for debugging a model that you'll eventually deploy on linux GPU
body: That variable is not used by TF, but by `dlopen` which is a system call. PS: only older macs support CUDA, which means that GPUs are old/slow and don't give a performance advantage over CPU. The main reason for using GPU tensorflow on Mac is for debugging a model that you'll eventually deploy on linux GPU
